repository.note: The default repository is the npm Registry at https://registry.npmjs.org

namespace_definition.note: The namespace is used for the scope of a scoped NPM package. The npm scope @ sign prefix is always percent encoded, as it was in the early days of npm scope.

name_definition.note: Per the package.json spec, new package 'must not have uppercase letters in the name', therefore the name must be lowercased. The npm name used to be case sensitive in the early days for some old packages.

common_patterns.description: Standard scoped package with encoded scope

steps.question: Does the package have a scope?
steps.yes: Look for %40 at the beginning of the name portion

steps.question: Is there a version component?
steps.yes: Parse everything after the last @ as version

context.backward_compatibility: Supports legacy case-sensitive names for old packages
context.forward_compatibility: New packages must follow strict lowercase rules

edge_cases.handling: While new packages must be lowercase, existing packages in registries may have mixed case
edge_cases.purl_impact: PURLs should normalize to lowercase for consistency

edge_cases.handling: Scoped packages can start with dots/underscores, unscoped cannot
edge_cases.purl_impact: Namespace validation differs from name validation

do_not_assume: Package names can have any characters
Versions don't need to follow SemVer

key_facts_to_remember: New package names must be lowercase

common_mistakes_to_avoid: Forgetting to encode the scope @ symbol
